intro: Ardisia lucida, commonly known as the shining evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Following the flowers, it produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Ardisia lucida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and year-round appearance.
